intro: Eriocarpum coloradense, commonly known as the Colorado eriocarpum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy fruit capsules. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
